description:
Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient


v9.1.0927
Nightly Vim Windows build snapshots (more information).If you do not know what to use, use the 32bit installer (use the signed one, if available).Signed releases will occasionally be provided on a best effort approach.Changes:
- 9.1.0927: style issues in insexpand.c
- 9.1.0926: filetype: Pixi lock files are not recognized
- runtime(doc): Add a reference to |++opt| and |+cmd| at `:h :pedit`
- runtime(doc): add a note about inclusive motions and exclusive selection
- 9.1.0925: Vim9: expression compiled when not necessary
Files:
:unlock: Unsigned Files:
- gvim_9.1.0927_x86.exe
32-bit installer (If you don't know what to use, use this one)
- gvim_9.1.0927_x64.exe
64-bit installer
- gvim_9.1.0927_x86.zip
32-bit zip archive
- gvim_9.1.0927_x64.zip
64-bit zip archive
- gvim_9.1.0927_x86_pdb.zip
pdb files for debugging the corresponding 32-bit executable
- gvim_9.1.0927_x64_pdb.zip
pdb files for debugging the corresponding 64-bit executable
- Strawberry Perl 5.32
- LuaBinaries 5.4
- Python 2.7
- Python3 3.8 or later
- Racket 8.7 (BC)
- RubyInstaller 3.2
- libsodium 1.0.19
See the README for detail.
